abstract: No phone plus no cable equals no business for many frustrated merchants in one of Manhattan's most expensive commercial districts.
snippet: No phone plus no cable equals no business for many frustrated merchants in one of Manhattan's most expensive commercial districts.
lead_paragraph: At Bistro Chat Noir, an upscale French restaurant on Manhattan's Upper East Side frequented by celebrities like Woody Allen, Madonna and Natalie Portman, the phone and Internet service is often out, so credit cards cannot be processed. When that happens, Suzanne Latapie, a manager and one of the owners, asks customers to fill out forms with their credit card information, so she can process payments later, sometimes using a neighbor's Internet line.

headline.main: Is Verizon Out Again?  Madison Ave. Can't Connect
